page.title: 12Railway (ctd).
page.content: or Middleton-in-Teesdale, passing through Winston. Royalty visiting nearby Raby Castle would alight there . Cattle and farm produce were despatched from Winston. It was once a very busy little station. In 1964 when the railway was closed, the stationmaster's son bought it and established a very successful haulage business. The booking office and waiting rooms are now used as offices. The engine house remains, but on the track beside it there is a concrete ramp for the inspection of lorries. Large work sheds and storage sheds have been built and alongside the small railway cottages there is a big modern house.
